poem:
### Ed Miliband

A figure in the swirl,  
balanced on the line—  
a leftward tilt  
of London fog,  
eyes focused forward  
through the haze.  
Kindness, substance,  
rare in the thrust,  
action in quiet  
revolution.  
Why the storm?  
The wind rages  
against calm  
that moves,  
anchor in the tempest,  
changing tides  
with steady breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why is Ed Miliband a target for all sides? Because he’s a lefty politician who gets things done | Andy Beckett Why exactly does Ed Miliband make so many people so angry? At 55, 20 years into his parliamentary career, with rare ministerial experience under both New Labour and Keir Starmer, and a reputation around Westminster and Whitehall as one of politics’ nicer, more knowledgeable characters, he could be a respected figure in a generally". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
